3: ...It's a complete failure. Looks like we've still overestimated our power.
The Ascendants are formidable foes after all. Though that 'Huaxu' thing's taken, we still kept the city intact in the end... Sort of.
After the battle in Kowloong, Akdilek and the Forsaken returned to their campsites to rest. The leaders are now sitting and discussing the next issue.
But they likely won't be thanking us for this. Most of Kowloong is in ruins. Even if they manage to salvage the place, rebuilding will likely be hell for them.
Speaking of, you know what the link chamber is?
I've heard of it before from some member who left Babylonia. It's a machine that allows a commandant to link remotely, or something... So what about it?
Babylonia seems to have successfully downsized these chambers.
Downsizing... Are they planning something big?
Probably. I only know that Babylonia is using their results for the foundation of their next step.
So that's why they're leaving squads in Kowloong to help them rebuild...
That's all the info I got. What about your end, Forsaken boss?
Don't get it wrong. I never agreed to exchange information with you.
Looks like you're trying to do a dine and dash on my train.
Watanabe's face takes on a stunned expression as Jamilah's words leave her mouth. After a short pause, he sighs resignedly.
...Fine. Just know that this info isn't something you can use as 'goods.'
Whether it can or can't is something I'll decide.
Watanabe hands a terminal to Jamilah. The screen shows a coordinate and a huge red X.
What's this?
This is information I got from... an Ascendant. It's supposedly their next target.
That red X is pointing to another Ascendant... Are Ascendants targeting other Ascendants?
Well, apparently, the leader of Kowloong is also an Ascendant. Maybe the Ascendants aren't all on the same side.
Indeed, this is also a possibility.
If there is infighting among the Ascendants, we will have an easier time, right?
The one who spoke is Changyu, who has just finished vehicle maintenance. Sophia follows, holding her tools.
Speaking of which... Leader, should we consider going to a water park for our next stop?
A water park?
Yep. The location those coordinates point to is called... What was it...
Venus Splash Park. In records of the Golden Age, it seems it was a 'movie-themed private water park.'
Yep, yep, that one. Sophia and I happened to see it while assessing the database, and we even discussed going there.
...You're the one who wants to go, Changyu.
You didn't say you don't want to, Sophia!
But Sophia has warned Changyu that the Venus Splash Park is surrounded by the ocean and there is no known track leading there.
...What a strange choice. Have you heard anything else?
That's all. The Ascendants didn't hide their tracks intentionally, and if Babylonia is not blind, they will know soon after we know.
Is that why you said this can no longer be called 'goods'?
Yes... If we calculate from the time we boarded the vehicle, it should be arriving at the station about now.
Right. Just get off at the broken stop ahead?
If it's you guys, I think it won't hurt to stay on the train. We will have an empty carriage after the re-org. So how about it? Want to become an Akdilek member?
...Stop joking. The Forsaken are an independent group and we have no interest in serving anyone else.
I know you have a history with Babylonia, but that shouldn't stop us from working together.
No need to worry about that. The Forsaken... are not a group formed from grudges and obsessions.
